title: Satellites have become smaller and cheaper — so even you can now do science in space
content:
Want to go to space? It could cost you. This month, the SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft will make the first fully-private, crewed flight to the International Space Station. The going price for a seat is US$55 million. The ticket comes with an eight-day stay on the space station, including room and board – and unrivaled views. Virgin Galactic and Blue Origin offer cheaper alternatives, which will fly you to the edge of space for a mere US$250,000-500,000. description: Advances in tiny satellite technology have brought Earth orbit within reach for private companies, researchers, and even do-it-yourself hobbyists.
